title: Bangladeshi freedom fighters, Indian war veterans participate in Victory Day visits
body: A delegation of eight Indian war veterans and two serving officers from the Indian Armed Forces arrived in Dhaka on December 14 to take part in Bangladesh’s Victory Day celebrations on December 16 and eight Bangladeshi freedom fighters and two serving officers from the Bangladesh Armed Forces arrived in Kolkata, India, on the same day to attend the Bijay Dibas celebrations. According to a press release issued by Indian high commission in Dhaka, Bangladeshi freedom fighters will meet Indian war veterans and senior officers from the Indian Army, Navy, and Air Force, who played a key role in training them and fighting alongside them in Bangladesh’s 1971 Liberation War. The Indian delegation will also hold discussions with freedom fighters and senior officers from the Bangladesh Army, Navy and Air Force. ‘These exchange visits provide a platform for Bangladeshi Muktijoddhas and Indian War Veterans to celebrate the unique friendship between our two countries and to renew memories of the Liberation War, which epitomises the shared sacrifices of the armed forces of Bangladesh and India for Bangladesh’s freedom from occupation, oppression and mass atrocities,’ adds the press release. India, meanwhile, on Tuesday greeted Bangladesh and people of the country on the occasion of Victory Day. Indian External Affairs Minister S Jaishnkar conveyed the greetings to Bangladesh and its people. ‘Greetings to Foreign Affairs Adviser Md Touhid Hossain, the Interim Government and the people of Bangladesh on Bijoy Dibosh,’ Jaishankar said in a message from his verified X handle on Tuesday.
